case_title: THE STATE through Chairman National Accountability Bureau vs ADAM KHAN JOKHIO and 2 others
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Accountability Acquittal Appeal No. 3 of 2008
appellant: THE STATE through Chairman National Accountability Bureau

accussed_details.name: Adam Khan Jokhio
allegation: Fraudulently changed land record from 30 acres to 330 acres
Benefited Rs. 150 million through manipulation of revenue records

accussed_details.name: Ghulam Haider Kalwar
allegation: Misused authority to manipulate revenue records
Collaborated with Adam Khan Jokhio in fraudulent activities

accussed_details.name: Ghulam Raza Rind
allegation: Misused authority to manipulate revenue records
Collaborated with Adam Khan Jokhio in fraudulent activities

complaint_summary: Accused manipulated land records to increase land area from 30 acres to 330 acres, causing loss to the national exchequer.
investigation_summary: Evidence revealed manipulation of revenue records by accused in collusion with public officials. Land was shown as 330 acres instead of 30 acres.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed in limine as the appellant failed to provide evidence of misreading or non-reading of evidence. The land in question was found vacant, and no third-party interest was created. Respondent No. 1 stated he did not claim interest in the manipulated land records.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued manipulation of land records caused loss to the government.
Defense argued land in question was vacant and no third-party interest was created.

witness_statement.Abdul Ghafoor: Denied knowledge of any agreement between his mother and respondent No.1 regarding the land.

key_issues: Misuse of authority by public officials

key_points.point: Whether accused Adam Khan Jokhio purchased 30 acres of land at Rs. 1,80,000 per acre from legal heirs of Mullah Pir Muhammad in 1994-95.
Whether accused Ghulam Haider Kalwar and deceased accused Ghulam Raza Rind misused their authority to manipulate revenue records and change 30 acres into 330 acres.
Whether accused Adam Khan Jokhio benefited Rs. 150 million by changing the revenue record, causing loss to the National Exchequer.

legal_terms.Revenue Record: Official record of land ownership and transactions.

words_and_phrases.Acquittal: Legal judgment that clears the accused of charges.
words_and_phrases.Dismissed in limine: Rejected at the outset without detailed examination.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves allegations of land record manipulation and corruption by public officials and private individuals. Appeal dismissed due to lack of evidence.
